title: Following are the top foreign stories at 2030 hours

snippet: In their first official press briefing since the Kabul seizure, the Taliban vowed to protect women's rights ''within the limits'' of Islamic law. ..

title: Use fuel wisely to save foreign currency to get down medicines, vaccines: Gammanpila
snippet: Energy Minister Udaya Gammanpila today requested the public to use fuel economically in view to save foreign currency to bring in the much-needed medicines and vaccines. In a Twitter message, he said the reality is that we are in a foreign currency crisis.

title: Trade union warns of lockdown action as Sri Lanka loses another 171 lives
snippet: As Sri Lanka confirmed a record 171 COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday (17), a trade union threatened a 10-day self-imposed lockdown starting next Monday (23), while government and opposition MPs traded charges on who was to blame for the country's worst public health crisis in recent times.

title: Unions promise "forced" lockdown, MPs trade allegations as Sri Lanka loses another 171 lives
